title: FiveThirtyEight - Wikipedia
snippet: In August 2010, the blog became a licensed feature of The New York Times online and was renamed FiveThirtyEight: Nate Silver's Political Calculus. In July 2013, ESPN acquired FiveThirtyEight, hiring Silver as editor-in-chief and a contributor for ESPN.com; the new publication launched on March ...

title: Publishers Daily: ABC News Buys 'FiveThirtyEight'
snippet: FiveThirtyEight was purchased by ESPN in 2013. The site's traffic grew from 3.6 million unique visitors in March 2015 to 11.5 million a year later, thanks to the fever surrounding the 2016 presidential election.

title: Nate Silver - Wikipedia
snippet: On July 22, 2013, ESPN (a subsidiary of the Walt Disney Company) announced that it had acquired ownership of the FiveThirtyEight website and brand, and that "Silver will serve as editor-in-chief of the site and will build a team of journalists, editors, analysts and contributors in the coming ...

title: Like it or not, ESPN isn't sticking to sports - ESPN - Public Editor- ESPN
snippet: ESPN assumed ownership in July 2013 and relaunched the site in March 2014. It’s now beyond its first presidential election under ESPN ownership and looking to expand its offerings in a few key subject areas.

title: Nate Silver’s FiveThirtyEight Moving From ESPN To ABC News
snippet: Nate Silver’s data-driven news site FiveThirtyEight is changing teams, with ABC News saying it has reached an agreement in principle to acquire the site from its Disney corporate sibling ESPN.
